phases.title: 🧭 Phase 1: Understand Game Dev (Weeks 1–2)
topics: What is Game Dev?
Engines: Unity, Unreal, Godot
Platforms: PC, Mobile, Console
Choose C#, C++, or GDScript
Learn Variables, Loops, OOP
Practice with small scripts
Unity: GameObjects, Physics, UI
Godot: Nodes, GDScript, Signals
Unreal: Blueprints, Actors, Levels

phases.title: 🧪 Phase 4: Build Games (Weeks 21–32)
topics: Pong, Flappy Bird, Shooter
Platformer, RPG, Puzzle Games

phases.title: 🖼️ Phase 5: Art, Audio & UI
topics: 2D/3D Art, Pixel Art, Blender
Sound Integration
UI Design, UX, Feedback

phases.title: 🔢 Phase 6: Game Math & Physics
topics: Vectors, Collisions, Trig
Pathfinding, AI Basics
Save Progress, Polish Game Feel
Particles, Screenshake, Transitions
Export to PC, Mobile, Web
Monetize: Ads, IAP, Steam, Patreon
Share Projects, Devlogs
Join Game Jams, Discords

phases.title: 🚀 Phase 10: Launch Your Career
topics: Portfolio, Resume, GitHub
Apply, Freelance, Build Studio

phases.title: 🧭 Phase 1: Foundations (Weeks 1–4)
topics: Understand basic concepts, tools, and workflows.
Learn key terminology and beginner-level frameworks or software.

phases.title: 🔧 Phase 2: Intermediate Skills (Weeks 5–12)
topics: Explore core workflows and tools used in the industry.
Build basic to intermediate level projects.

phases.title: 🎯 Phase 3: Specialization (Weeks 13–20)
topics: Learn advanced tools and techniques.
Pick a niche and go deep.
Build a specialization project or contribute to open source.

phases.title: 💼 Phase 4: Real-world Practice (Weeks 21–28)
topics: Build a strong portfolio.
Take on freelance/client work, hackathons, or internships.

phases.title: 🚀 Phase 5: Launch Your Career
topics: Prepare resume, LinkedIn, and GitHub.
Apply for jobs or freelance gigs.
Keep learning and building!

phases.title: 🧭 Phase 1: Understanding the Basics (Weeks 1–4)
topics: What is HTTP/HTTPS?
What is a browser and how it renders pages
Understand client vs server
DNS, Hosting, Domain Names
[MDN Web Docs - How the Web Works](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Getting_started_with_the_web/How_the_Web_works)
YouTube: Computerphile channel
HTML Elements, Attributes
Semantic HTML
Forms & Inputs
Tables, Lists, Images, Links
Selectors, Properties, Specificity
Box Model 📦
Positioning
Flexbox 💪
Grid Layout 🧩
Media Queries
Transitions and Animations
Basic Accessibility ♿
freeCodeCamp
Flexbox Froggy
CSS Tricks

phases.title: 🔧 Phase 3: JavaScript Fundamentals (Weeks 9–16)
topics: Variables, Data Types
Conditionals, Functions
Arrays, Objects, Loops
DOM Manipulation
Events
ES6+ Syntax

phases.title: 📦 Phase 4: Dev Tools & Git (Weeks 17–20)
topics: Git/GitHub Basics
VS Code, DevTools
Prettier, ESLint

phases.title: ⚛️ Phase 5: React (Weeks 21–32)
topics: Components, Props, State
Hooks (useState, useEffect)
Routing, Forms
React Libraries

phases.title: 🧪 Phase 6: Advanced Concepts
topics: State Management
API Integration
Auth, Lazy Loading
Testing, a11y, SEO

phases.title: 💼 Phase 7: Build Projects
topics: Portfolio, Blog, E-Commerce
Deploy to Netlify, Vercel
TypeScript, Tailwind
Next.js, Framer Motion
CI/CD, PWAs

phases.title: 🚀 Phase 8: Get Hired
topics: Resume, LinkedIn, GitHub
Interviews, Projects
Networking, Open Source
